page.title: 01Glen Noe and Clan MacIntyre
page.content: Glen Noe drops from high ground near the east summit of Ben Cruachan to sea level at Loch Etive. The glen is the traditional homeland of Clan MacIntyre. The land is part of Glen Noe estate and is private. This part of the estate farms about 1000 black- face ewes. Stalking yields about eight stags per annum. There are only two houses, the homes of Mr George Fleming, Estate owner, and of Mr Ronald Gordon, Farm manager. Post is delivered by Royal Mail launch on Loch Etive as there are no public roads in or to the glen. A ruin sometimes associated with Clan MacIntyre is now considered to be of too recent construction. MacIntyre's from America have placed a commemorative Cairn and plaque on the shore. There are sober suggestions that the glen is haunted as ghostly sounds of a bell ringing
